page.title: 08Coton Clanford Farm
page.content: The farmhouse, formerly a public house is about 200 years old. It is built of red brick with a large farmhouse kitchen, lounge and four bedrooms. There are several outbuildings for fuel and storage purposes. Some of the outhouses have been modern- ised and now consist of a cowshed, milking parlour and holding yard. The holding yard is an open compound where the cows are kept in winter. The manpower on the farm includes Mr Taylor, a full-time worker who lives in and another worker on a Youth Training Scheme. These workers run the eighty acre Coton Clanford Farm, the fifty acre Stocking Gate Farm and another farm at Seighford of one hundred and eighty acres.
